interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Arthur Christmas
Review Date: 2013/03/01
Store: Sarah Smith  (Director)    Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'How CAN Santa deliver billions of presents to the whole world in just one night? With an army of one million combat-style Field Elves and a vast, state-of-the-art control center under the ice of the North Pole! So how could this incredible operation have MISSED one child?! To Santa’s young son, Arthur, it threatens to end the magic of Christmas. With retired Grandsanta, a rebellious young elf, an old sleigh and some untrained reindeer, Arthur sets out in a crazy mission to deliver the last present! Deck the halls with excitement, fun and wonder in this new Christmas classic!', 'Amazon.com']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Family, Animation, Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Sarah Smith, David Sproxton, Aardman Animations; Columbia Pictures; Sony Pictures Animation Inc., Peter Lord, Steve Pegram, Carla ShelleySarah Smith, David Sproxton, Aardman Animations; Columbia Pictures; Sony Pictures Animation Inc., Peter Lord, Steve Pegram, Carla Shelley   See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 37 minutes', 'Digital Copy Expiration Date': 'December 31, 2017', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '40952', 'Director': 'Sarah Smith', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 37 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 6, 2012', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish, English', 'Producers': 'Peter Lord, David Sproxton, Carla Shelley, Steve Pegram', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Seller was great, but this tale of Christmas was awful in many ways. If you don't want a spoiler, don't read, but Christmas now comes from an "alien" sort of ship delivered by thousands of odd looking elves and Santa is just "in charge" - an old sort of "out of it" guy. It is not a classic I will want to watch again. There were terrible moments that made me want to cry. How is that a happy Christmas?
Review Title: A really bizarre way to represent Christmas
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Frankenweenie
Martin Short  (Actor),     Catherine O'Hara  (Actor),     Tim Burton  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment, All Disney Titles
['Product Description', 'From Disney and creative genius Tim Burton (ALICE IN WONDERLAND; THE NIGHTMARE BEFORE CHRISTMAS) comes the hilarious and offbeat FRANKENWEENIE, a heartwarming tale about a boy and his dog. After unexpectedly losing his beloved dog Sparky, young Victor harnesses the power of science to bring his best friend back to life -- with just a few minor adjustments. He tries to hide his home-sewn creation, but when Sparky gets out, Victor\'s fellow students, teachers and the entire town learn that getting a new "leash on life" can be monstrous. Complete with electrifying bonus features, FRANKENWEENIE is alive with enchanting fun for the whole family.', 'Brand Story', 'By']
{'Genre': 'Animation', 'Format': 'AC-3, Animated, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen, Dubbed, Enhanced', 'Contributor': "Charlie Tahan, Robert Capron, Martin Short, Tim Burton, Martin Landau, Atticus Shaffer, Catherine O'Hara, Winona RyderCharlie Tahan, Robert Capron, Martin Short, Tim Burton, Martin Landau, Atticus Shaffer, Catherine O'Hara, Winona Ryder  See more", 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 27 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'MFR786936814149#VG', 'Director': 'Tim Burton', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Animated, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen, Dubbed, Enhanced', 'Run time': '1 hour and 27 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 8, 2013', 'Actors': "Martin Short, Catherine O'Hara, Martin Landau, Winona Ryder, Robert Capron", 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish, English', 'Studio': 'WALT DISNEY PICTURES', 'Number of discs': '1'}
If you do not "get" Tim Burton, this movie may not thrill you, but the art is incredible. You have to consider the pain-stacking stop-motion work despite the odd story-line. This is art at its best. I was only sad that he didn't work with Johny Depp on this one.
You have to love Tim Burton!
Arthur Christmas
Sarah Smith  (Director)    Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
['Product Description', 'How CAN Santa deliver billions of presents to the whole world in just one night? With an army of one million combat-style Field Elves and a vast, state-of-the-art control center under the ice of the North Pole! So how could this incredible operation have MISSED one child?! profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Favorite Genre**: Animation, with a preference for unique and offbeat storytelling, particularly in the realm of family-friendly content.
  
- **Preferred Directors**: Strong admiration for Tim Burton and other creative directors, indicating an appreciation for distinctive artistic styles and storytelling approaches.

- **Artistic Appreciation**: High regard for animation as an art form, specifically valuing the intricacies of stop-motion techniques and visual aesthetics.

- **Emotional Depth**: Interest in narratives that blend heartwarming themes with unusual or darker elements, though recent experiences have revealed a critique of certain portrayals that stray from traditional values.

- **Review Engagement**: Willingness to provide detailed feedback on media consumption, highlighting both artistic merit and personal sentiments regarding creative choices, including expressing disappointment with themes that do not resonate well.

- **Value in Collaborations**: Notable interest in collaborative works among prominent actors and directors, reflecting a desire for unique creative partnerships in animation.

Recent interactions indicate a more critical stance towards certain animated works that attempt unconventional narratives, particularly in the context of cherished themes like Christmas. This user seeks imaginative animations but now shows concern for creative choices that may detract from emotional fulfillment. Overall, the user continues to be drawn to imaginative storytelling but with increased scrutiny regarding execution.
